intro: Neomitranthes glomerata, commonly known as the clustered sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Neomitranthes glomerata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland dune ecosystems.
